features.situation: from sapient being with whom you actively interact (converse, lecture, etc.)

advantages.name: 3 - Choose an additional 20 points in Advantages from the following list:

features.situation: from sapient being with whom you actively interact (converse, lecture, etc.)
from members of your religion and those who respect your faith

children.name: Longevity
children.notes: You fail aging rolls only on a 17 or 18, or only on an 18 if your modified HT is 17 or better

features.situation: to rolls for any lengthy mental task you concentrate on to the exclusion of other activities, if the GM feels such focus would be beneficial
to all rolls to notice interruptions while obsessed with a task

modifiers.name: Specialized
modifiers.notes: @Type: Angels, Demons, Elementals, Faerie, Ghosts, etc.@

advantages.name: 4 - Choose -30 points in Disadvantages from the following list:

children.name: Code of Honor (Professional)
children.notes: Adhere to the ethics of your profession; always do your job to the best of your ability; support your guild, union, or professional association.

advantages.name: 6 - Choose an additional -30 points in Disadvantages from the following list:

children.name: Code of Honor (Professional)
children.notes: Adhere to the ethics of your profession; always do your job to the best of your ability; support your guild, union, or professional association.

children.name: Curious
children.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with an interesting item or situation

children.name: Nightmares
children.notes: Make a self-control roll each morning upon awakening. If you fail, you suffered nightmares; this costs you 1 FP that you can only recover through sleep. On a roll of 17 or 18, you are left shaking, and are at -1 to all skill and Perception rolls for the entire day.

children.name: Overconfidence

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are

children.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

children.name: Vow (Choose a Minor, Major or Great Vow) [varies]

skills.name: 8 - Choose one additional Wildcard Skill from the following list:
10 - Choose four Skills from the following list:
11 - Choose one Exotic Skill from the following list:
12 - Chose four Techniques (Spells) from the following list:

notes.text: You’re a master of comic-book wizardry, enabling you to use a wide range of magical spells including very powerful ones. Your primary function is to protect the world from supernatural threats – or, if you’re on the other side, to help carry out those threats! Your familiarity with the uncanny gives you an impressive sense of added self-confidence. If you have powers as well as Magery and spells, their usual limitation is Magical (-10%). Alternatives are Divine (-10%), Moral (-20%), Nature (-20%), and Spirit (-25%).
The master mage is built on 500 points.
